comment.author: 20727502@N00
comment._content: Anyone (from Rathmines direction) know where Bernadette Hall is/was? Sounds like it was on Richmond Hill. And may have been used by the Deaf Society for a while. Perhaps theatre-types will be more familiar with the Bernadette Players, but I can't find any reviews/write-ups on this bizarrely named production. (Save for this mention a year later in Seán O'Faoláin's lit-journal "The Bell")

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/20727502@N00] Feiseanna were held here, according to various newspapers, and plays, pantomimes (like the above), etc.

If it's any help re the location, it seems that quite often bookings were taken from 43 Rugby Road or the Presbytery, Rathmines.

comment._content: The "It's Behind You!" Limerick If you think that your pennies need spending A 'Panto' is well worth attending. A Witch, Fairy Queen, And a Monster are seen - With a thankfully quick Happy Ending!
